title: Augusta County: F. S. Tukey to Samuel Hunt, January 29, 1866
summary: Tukey informs Hunt of AMA teachers' boarding arrangements in Staunton and explains that he has paid the majority of the rent for a schoolhouse. Hoping that the Association would assume responsibility for the financial burden of paying rent for AMA buildings, he requests reimbursement for personal funds used to secure facilities for Association use.
keywords: African Americans, Education, Economy, Women, Race Relations, American Civil War
